page.title: 10CHURCHES_ANCIENT SITES
page.content: The Church of England is represented by two churches; St. John the Baptist at Harrietsham and the small church at Broomfield. At Platt's Heath a small chapel dedicated to St. Edmund is used for services as part of the living of the parish of Lenham and is also used as a community centre for local use. In Harrietsham a small Roman Catholic mission is situated near the old Remand home (now closed). The Jehovah's Witnesses also have a church not far from the parish church. Recently excavations have revealed the remains of some very ancient buildings,thought to be Saxon or Roman in origin, in the grounds of the Rectory at Harrietsham. Excavations have also been undertaken at Runham on the site of a Roman or Iron Age furnace recently discovered there.
